Author: CanvasFanatic

Comment: They do and they don’t do that. Both the flu and Covid vaccines originally went through controlled trials. This is about the annual variants. Every spring/summer, scientists look at which strains are emerging/on the upswing, and use that to tailor the manufacturing over the summer so you can get a shot in the fall and be protected from those strains in the winter. What he wants is some proof that this year’s vaccine is effective before it is approved for manufacturing. But if we wait long enough to see that, then it will be too late make sufficient quantities, vaccinate, and protect people. We’ll be protecting them against last year’s variant.

Comment: No. The agency is given a scope of responsibility, and guidelines for how to fill that scope. That's written into the law passed by Congress. If the exceeds the authority given to it, it's actions can be overturned in court. The authority granted is not unlimited. The Judicial and Legislative both have the authority to reign it in.  The problem we're having now is that the executive is exceed it's authority without regard for the law to begin with and ignoring the courts. Congress \*should\* respond by revoking that authority and bringing the executive back into line. It's choosing not to, because this is what Republicans want.  The real problem is that the Justice Department is part of the executive for some reason, so a corrupt executive can capture multiple branches worth of authority without having to control that third branch. It doesn't matter what the courts say if no one backs it up. If we get out of this mess, making the Justice Department a completely independent branch will be essential.
